results.title: Our wonderful ears and their care
results.brief_description: Using diagrams and an ear model, a doctor explains the structure of the ear, how sounds are heard and how ears should be cared for. No other credits available.

results.title: Our wonderful body: medicines, drugs and poisons

results.title: Our wheat industry
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Peter Whitchurch Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A survey of the Australian wheat industry, its early history and its importance to the national economy. Shows the early attempts by Farrer to produce a rust-resistant wheat; the type of wheat developed by Farrer for cultivation in the dry inland areas; the importance and extent of the present day wheat industry; problems confronting the wheat farmer; transport and storage of wheat; the manufacture of flour.

results.title: Our water our future
results.creator_credit: Arron Wood, Katherine McIntosh, Highland Productions, Victoria. Dept. of Sustainability and Environment and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description:
This documentary provides an entertaining, informative and educational insight into how Victoria’s homes, farms, environment and industries depend on a secure water supply. It explores the contrasts between rural and urban Victoria, demonstrating that water security is a statewide issue affecting everyone. Hosted by Arron Wood,
Environmental Scientist.

results.title: Our town
results.creator_credit: Sol Lesser, Principal Artists and Sam Woods
results.brief_description: Thorton Wilder’s Pulitzer Prize-winning play was adapted to the screen, bringing to life an array of wonderful characters played by an impressive cast. Set in Grover’s Corner, New Hampshire, the typical American small-town of the early 1900’s is vividly recreated. Frank Craven as the narrator takes us on a “peephole” tour where we are given a simple yet dramatic account of what goes on in the lives of people from childhood to courtship; from birth to death. A young William Holden and Martha Scott in her first screen appearance, are the focal characters. Sam Wood’s techniques: a series of dazzling dissolves, evocative lighting and effective montages capture the essence of the period, so much so, that “Our Town” has become a cinema classic to be treasured in the hearts of film lovers.

results.title: Our time in the garden
results.creator_credit: Susan Woll, Ron Blau and Central Studios
results.brief_description: Fifty-year old films from the home movies of the Blau family, Berlin Jews who lived in the Grunewald until 1933. Striking impressions of a happy life before the coming of Fascism. Made by Ron Blau. Voice of Gerda Blau.

results.title: Our three r's
results.brief_description: A survey of educational services provided in the city of Glasgow. First there is a resume of curriculum and activities in primary schools, then in secondary schools, and finally the opportunities for technical training for day-release students.

results.title: Our street was paved with gold
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, ONF | NFB and Albert Kish
results.brief_description: A filmmaker revisits Montreal’s St. Lawrence Boulevard—the Main—the road from the docks to the heart of immigrant Canada. This is a little Europe, a street of many languages, many Old World foodstuffs, a hundred small courtesies that make the stranger feel at home. For the filmmaker his prevailing memory is of the seventeen steps of a walk-up apartment, but for all Canadians, born or made, this film has many nostalgic links with a common Canadian experience.

results.title: Our story in stamps
results.brief_description: The production of Malayan postage stamps in Britain. Working from a basic design selected in Malaya, British craftsmen prepare and print the perforated sheets of stamps. Intricate printing processes and skilled workmanship go into their creation. Locale sequences in Malaya reveal the relationships between the symbolic designs on the stamps and the landscape, industries and crafts of the country.
